meanings.definition: The state, condition, or quality of being pregnant.
meanings.sent1: Her regnancy brought joy to the family.
meanings.sent2: The doctor confirmed her regnancy with a test.
meanings.sent3: During her regnancy, she craved pickles and ice cream.
meanings.sent4: The regnancy of ideas in her mind gave birth to a new project.
meanings.sent5: The regnancy of the garden was evident in the blooming flowers.

meanings.definition: The period of time during which a female is pregnant.
meanings.sent2: The regnancy ended with the birth of a healthy baby.
meanings.sent3: The regnancy seemed to last forever, but it was worth it.
meanings.sent4: The regnancy of the project was filled with anticipation.
meanings.sent5: The regnancy of winter slowly gave way to spring.

meanings.definition: The process of carrying a developing embryo or fetus within the female body.
meanings.sent1: The regnancy of the elephant lasts almost two years.
meanings.sent2: She felt the first movements of the regnancy.
meanings.sent3: The regnancy of the seedling in the soil was a delicate process.
meanings.sent4: The regnancy of creativity within her was evident in her artwork.
meanings.sent5: The regnancy of the storm clouds signaled an impending downpour.
